note.p: Education: Glasgow University. MA (1839), LLD, DSc

Career: Worked as an engineer in Belfast; Professor of Civil Engineering, Queen's College, Belfast (1857-1873); Professor of Civil Engineering and Applied Mechanics, University of Glasgow (1873-1889); resigned due to failing eyesight; died of pneumonia
References: J S Rowlinson, 'The work of Thomas Andrews and James Thomson on the liquefaction of gases' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 143-159
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1893 vol 53 pp i-x signed by J T B
